New Records: England lost to Brazil for the 12th time in 27 matches, with just four wins
Key Match Events: Endrick scored the only goal of the match for Brazil
Vinícius Júnior was denied by Jordan Pickford, but Endrick scored from the rebound
Lewis Dunk made an error that led to the goal
Andreas Pereira released Vinícius Júnior in behind John Stones
Endrick had a stoppage-time chance, but was denied by Jordan Pickford
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil was portrayed as being in crisis, but they performed well in the match
England was missing key players, including Harry Kane, Luke Shaw, and Bukayo Saka
Gareth Southgate praised England's new boys in the post-match interview
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate was left with much to ponder before the next friendly against Belgium
England's record against Brazil is now 12 defeats in 27 matches, with just four wins
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a friendly to fine-tune for the European Championship in the summer
Endrick will join Real Madrid in the summer
The Wembley crowd was subdued, and the atmosphere was flat throughout the match
Others: England was vulnerable in the first half, and Brazil's physical force was a challenge for them
Jude Bellingham was booked for a lunge at Bruno Guimarães, and Phil Foden failed to impact the game
